name: Freeport
description: Secure storage facility in Oslo, Norway used in art heists and inversion-based operations.

content.title: Geography
content.body: Freeport is located at the Oslo Airport, designed to be a tax-free, high-security storage facility primarily for artworks and other valuable items.

content.title: Notable Features
content.body:
- **Security**: The Freeport is equipped with advanced security systems, including blast-proof storage areas and oxygen-deprivation as a defense mechanism.
- **Vaults**: The core of the Freeport consists of highly secure vaults used for storing art and valuables.

content.title: Story Significance
content.body: Freeport plays a pivotal role in the film 'Tenet' as a location where The Protagonist and Neil execute a heist to retrieve a piece of the algorithm. The reverse temporal mechanics are prominently featured here, showcasing the complexity of the operation through inversion.
